content: pattern on right side of thumb m see round 4 work in rib as set incorporating incs into chart the rib pattern on the left side of thumb m see chart repeat rnds 3 and 4 until you have 20 20 25 sts on n1 between the bor m and thumb m repeat rnds 3 and 4 until you have 22 22 27 sts on n3 to the left of thumb m left thumb continue in rib across 20 20 25 sts remove right thumb thumb m move next 15 15 20 sts to stitch work in rib to 15 15 20 sts before thumb m holder or scrap yarn continue in rib to end of round move next 15 15 20 sts to stitch holder or scrap 50 55 60 sts yarn remove thumb m continue in rib to end of round 50 55 60 sts continue in rib for 1 5 approx 15 rnds for short style or 2 approx 20 rnds for long style or to continue in rib for 1 5 approx 15 rnds for short desired length style or 2 approx 20 rnds for long style or to desired length bobble in rib bobble in rib bor end of n3 = knit = thumb marker = purl = cuff = m1r increase one stitch right slanting = repeat this section 3 3 4 times these are palm sts not thumb sts = m1l increase one stitch left slanting pioneer gloves pg 6 thumb note the thumb is worked the same way for both the right and left glove move sts from the holder to dpns attach yarn and pick up and knit 5 sts at gap this is a bit tricky but you can do it 20 20 25 sts divide evenly join in the round pm for beg of round the rib for the left glove will be worked as k3 p2 the rib for the right glove will be p2 k3 work in rib for 0 75 approx 8 rnds or to desired length bobble in rib finishing weave in ends block lightly if desired abbreviations pg 7 approx = approximately pm = place marker beg = beginning prev = previous bobble = bind off psso = passover bor = beginning of round pu = pick up cc = contrasting colour pwise = purlwise chain = chain rem = remaining circ s = circular needle s repeat = repeat cn = cable needle rev st st = reverse stockinette stitch co = cast on round s = round s cont = continue rs = right side double_crochet = double_crochet single_crochet = single_crochet dpn s = double pointed needle s skip = skip decrease s = decrease s skp = slip one stitch knit one stich pass slipped stitch foll = follow ing over knitted stitch decrease half_double_crochet = half-double_crochet sl = slip hk = hook sl1k = slip one stitch knitwise increase = increase sl1p = slip one stitch purlwise incl = including
